properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker container.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Required, string) The ID of the image to back this container. The easiest way to get this value is to use the docker_image resource as is shown in the example above.

properties.name: command
properties.description: • command - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the container. For example, to run /usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf set the command to be ["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"].

properties.name: entrypoint
properties.description: • entrypoint - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use as the Entrypoint for the container. The Entrypoint allows you to configure a container to run as an executable. For example, to run /usr/bin/myprogram when starting a container, set the entrypoint to be ["/usr/bin/myprogram"].

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional, string) User used for run the first process. Format is user or user:group which user and group can be passed literraly or by name.

properties.name: dns
properties.description: • dns - (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS servers.

properties.name: dns_opts
properties.description: • dns_opts - (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS options used by the DNS provider(s), see resolv.conf documentation for valid list of options.

properties.name: dns_search
properties.description: • dns_search - (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS search domains that are used when bare unqualified hostnames are used inside of the container.

properties.name: env
properties.description: • env - (Optional, set of strings) Environment variables to set.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional, map of strings) Key/value pairs to set as labels on the container.

properties.name: links
properties.description: • links - (Optional, set of strings) Set of links for link based connectivity between containers that are running on the same host.

Warning The --link flag is a legacy feature of Docker. It may eventually be removed. It exposes all environment variables originating from Docker to any linked containers. This could have serious security implications if sensitive data is stored in them. See [the docker documentation][linkdoc] for more details.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Optional, string) Hostname of the container.

properties.name: domainname
properties.description: (Optional, string) Domain name of the container.

properties.name: restart
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The restart policy for the container. Must be
one of "no", "on-failure", "always", "unless-stopped".

properties.name: max_retry_count
properties.description: (Optional, int) The maximum amount of times to an attempt a restart when restart is set to "on-failure"

properties.name: working_dir
properties.description: - (Optional, string) The working directory for commands to run in

properties.name: rm
properties.description:
(Optional, bool) If true, then the container will be automatically removed after his execution. Terraform
won't check this container after creation.

properties.name: start
properties.description:
(Optional, bool) If true, then the Docker container will be
started after creation. If false, then the container is only created.

properties.name: attach
properties.description: (Optional, bool) If true attach to the container after its creation and waits the end of his execution.

properties.name: logs
properties.description: (Optional, bool) Save the container logs (attach must be enabled).

properties.name: must_run
properties.description:
(Optional, bool) If true, then the Docker container will be
kept running. If false, then as long as the container exists, Terraform
assumes it is successful.

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Capabilities below for details.

properties.name: mounts
properties.description: (Optional, set of blocks) See Mounts below for details.

properties.name: tmpfs
properties.description: (Optional, map) A map of container directories which should be replaced by tmpfs mounts, and their corresponding mount options.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Ports below for details.

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Extra Hosts below for details.

properties.name: privileged
properties.description: (Optional, bool) Run container in privileged mode.

properties.name: devices
properties.description: (Optional, bool) See Devices below for details.

properties.name: publish_all_ports
properties.description: (Optional, bool) Publish all ports of the container.

properties.name: volumes
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Volumes below for details.

properties.name: memory
properties.description: (Optional, int) The memory limit for the container in MBs.

properties.name: memory_swap
properties.description: (Optional, int) The total memory limit (memory + swap) for the container in MBs. This setting may compute to -1 after terraform apply if the target host doesn't support memory swap, when that is the case docker will use a soft limitation.

properties.name: shm_size
properties.description: (Optional, int) Size of /dev/shm in MBs.

properties.name: cpu_shares
properties.description: (Optional, int) CPU shares (relative weight) for the container.

properties.name: cpu_set
properties.description: (Optional, string) A comma-separated list or hyphen-separated range of CPUs a container can use, e.g. 0-1.

properties.name: log_driver
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The logging driver to use for the container.
Defaults to "json-file".

properties.name: log_opts
properties.description:
(Optional, map of strings) Key/value pairs to use as options for
the logging driver.

properties.name: network_alias
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) Network aliases of the container for user-defined networks only. Deprecated: use networks_advanced instead.

properties.name: network_mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) Network mode of the container.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) Id of the networks in which the container is. Deprecated: use networks_advanced instead.

properties.name: networks_advanced
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Networks Advanced below for details. If this block has priority to the deprecated network_alias and network properties.

properties.name: destroy_grace_seconds
properties.description: (Optional, int) If defined will attempt to stop the container before destroying. Container will be destroyed after n seconds or on successful stop.

properties.name: upload
properties.description: (Optional, block) See File Upload below for details.

properties.name: ulimit
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Ulimits below for details.

properties.name: pid_mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) The PID (Process) Namespace mode for the container. Either container:<name|id> or host.

properties.name: userns_mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) Sets the usernamespace mode for the container when usernamespace remapping option is enabled.

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Healthcheck below for details.

properties.name: sysctls
properties.description: (Optional, map) A map of kernel parameters (sysctls) to set in the container.

properties.name: ipc_mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) IPC sharing mode for the container. Possible values are: none, private, shareable, container:<name|id> or host.

properties.name: group_add
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) Add additional groups to run as.

properties.name: capabilities-1
properties.description: » Capabilities

capabilities is a block within the configuration that allows you to add or drop linux capabilities. For more information about what capabilities you can add and drop please visit the docker run documentation.

properties.name: add
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) list of linux capabilities to add.

properties.name: drop
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) list of linux capabilities to drop.
Example:

resource "docker_container" "ubuntu" {
  name  = "foo"
  image = "${docker_image.ubuntu.latest}"

  capabilities {
    add  = ["ALL"]
    drop = ["SYS_ADMIN"]
  }
}

properties.name: mounts-1
properties.description: » Mounts

mounts is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra mount mappings for the container. Each mounts block is the Specification for mounts to be added to container and supports the following:

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required, string) The container path.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional, string) The mount source (e.g., a volume name, a host path)

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required, string) The mount type: valid values are bind|volume|tmpfs.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description: (Optional, string) Whether the mount should be read-only

properties.name: list description
propagation
properties.description: (Optional, string) A propagation mode with the value.

properties.name: list description
no_copy
properties.description: (Optional, string) Whether to populate volume with data from the target.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of key/value pairs) Adding labels.

properties.name: driver_options
properties.description: (Optional, map of key/value pairs) Options for the driver.

properties.name: list description
size_bytes
properties.description: (Optional, int) The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional, int) The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer.

properties.name: ports-1
properties.description: » Ports
ports is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the port mappings of the container. Each ports block supports the following:

properties.name: internal
properties.description: (Required, int) Port within the container.

properties.name: external
properties.description: (Optional, int) Port exposed out of the container. If not given a free random port >= 32768 will be used.

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Optional, string) IP address/mask that can access this port, default to 0.0.0.0

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional, string) Protocol that can be used over this port, defaults to tcp.

properties.name: extra-hosts
properties.description: » Extra Hosts
host is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra host mappings for the container. Each host block supports the following:

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Required, string) Hostname to add.

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Required, string) IP address this hostname should resolve to.
This is equivalent to using the --add-host option when using the run command of the Docker CLI.

properties.name: volumes-1
properties.description: » Volumes
volumes is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the volumes attached to a container. Each volumes block supports the following:

properties.name: from_container
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The container where the volume is
coming from.

properties.name: host_path
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The path on the host where the volume
is coming from.

properties.name: volume_name
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The name of the docker volume which
should be mounted.

properties.name: container_path
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The path in the container where the
volume will be mounted.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description:
(Optional, bool) If true, this volume will be readonly.
Defaults to false.
One of from_container, host_path or volume_name must be set.

properties.name: file-upload
properties.description: » File Upload

upload is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify files to upload to the container before starting it. Only one of content or content_base64 can be set and at least one of them hast to be set. Each upload supports the following

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Optional, string, conflicts with content_base64) Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.

properties.name: content_base64
properties.description: (Optional, string, conflicts with content) Base64-encoded data that will be decoded and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content. This allows safely uploading non-UTF8 binary data, but is recommended only for larger binary content such as the result of the base64encode interpolation function. See here for the reason.

properties.name: file
properties.description: (Required, string) path to a file in the container.

properties.name: executable
properties.description:
(Optional, bool) If true, the file will be uploaded with user
executable permission.
Defaults to false.

properties.name: network-advanced
properties.description: » Network advanced
networks_advanced is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify advanced options for the container in a specific network. Each networks_advanced supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the network.

properties.name: aliases
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) The network aliases of the container in the specific network.

properties.name: ipv4_address
properties.description: (Optional, string) The IPV4 address of the container in the specific network.

properties.name: ipv6_address
properties.description: (Optional, string) The IPV6 address of the container in the specific network.

properties.name: devices-1
properties.description: » Devices
devices is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the devices exposed to a container. Each devices block supports the following:

properties.name: host_path
properties.description:
(Required, string) The path on the host where the device
is located.

properties.name: container_path
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The path in the container where the
device will be binded.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: (Optional, string) The cgroup permissions given to the container to access the device. Defaults to rwm.

properties.name: ulimits
properties.description: » Ulimits
ulimit is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra ulimits for the container. Each ulimit block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string)

properties.name: soft
properties.description: (Required, int)

properties.name: hard
properties.description: (Required, int)

properties.name: healthcheck-1
properties.description: » Healthcheck

healthcheck is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra healthcheck configuration for the container. The healthcheck block is a test to perform to check that the container is healthy and supports the following:

properties.name: test
properties.description: (Required, list of strings) Command to run to check health. For example, to run curl -f http://localhost/health set the command to be ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost/health"].

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional, string) Time between running the check (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional, string) Maximum time to allow one check to run (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: start_period
properties.description: (Optional, string) Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: retries
properties.description: (Optional, int) Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Default: 0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker image, including any tags or SHA256 repo digests.

properties.name: keep_locally
properties.description:
(Optional, boolean) If true, then the Docker image won't be
deleted on destroy operation. If this is false, it will delete the image from
the docker local storage on destroy operation.

properties.name: pull_triggers
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings) List of values which cause an image pull when changed. This is used to store the image digest from the registry when using the docker_registry_image data source to trigger an image update.

properties.name: pull_trigger
properties.description: Deprecated, use pull_triggers instead.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker network.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of string/string key/value pairs) User-defined key/value metadata.

properties.name: check_duplicate
properties.description:
(Optional, boolean) Requests daemon to check for networks
with same name.

properties.name: driver
properties.description: (Optional, string) Name of the network driver to use. Defaults to bridge driver.

properties.name: options
properties.description:
(Optional, map of strings) Network specific options to be used by
the drivers.

properties.name: internal
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Restrict external access to the network. Defaults to false.

properties.name: attachable
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Enable manual container attachment to the network. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ingress
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Create swarm routing-mesh network. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Enable IPv6 networking. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ipam_driver
properties.description:
(Optional, string) Driver used by the custom IP scheme of the
network.

properties.name: ipam_config
properties.description: (Optional, block) See IPAM config below for details.

properties.name: ipam-config
properties.description: » IPAM config
Configuration of the custom IP scheme of the network.
The ipam_config block supports:

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Optional, string)

properties.name: ip_range
properties.description: (Optional, string)

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: (Optional, string)

properties.name: aux_address
properties.description: (Optional, map of string)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The name of the Docker volume (generated if not
provided).

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of string/string key/value pairs) User-defined key/value metadata.

properties.name: driver
properties.description: (Optional, string) Driver type for the volume (defaults to local).

properties.name: driver_opts
properties.description: (Optional, map of strings) Options specific to the driver.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker config.

properties.name: data
properties.description: (Required, string) The base64 encoded data of the config.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker secret.

properties.name: data
properties.description: (Required, string) The base64 encoded data of the secret.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of string/string key/value pairs) User-defined key/value metadata.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: auth
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Auth below for details.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the Docker service.

properties.name: task_spec
properties.description: (Required, block) See TaskSpec below for details.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Mode below for details.

properties.name: update_config
properties.description: (Optional, block) See UpdateConfig below for details.

properties.name: rollback_config
properties.description: (Optional, block) See RollbackConfig below for details.

properties.name: endpoint_spec
properties.description: (Optional, block) See EndpointSpec below for details.

properties.name: converge_config
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Converge Config below for details.

properties.name: auth-1
properties.description: » Auth
auth can be used additionally to the registry_auth. If both properties are given the auth wins and overwrites the auth of the provider.

properties.name: server_address
properties.description: (Required, string) The address of the registry server

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Optional, string) The username to use for authenticating to the registry. If this is blank, the DOCKER_REGISTRY_USER is also be checked.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional, string) The password to use for authenticating to the registry. If this is blank, the DOCKER_REGISTRY_PASS is also be checked.

properties.name: taskspec
properties.description: » TaskSpec

task_spec is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The task_spec block is the user modifiable task configuration and supports the following:

properties.name: container_spec
properties.description: (Required, block) See ContainerSpec below for details.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Resources below for details.

properties.name: restart_policy
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Restart Policy below for details.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Placement below for details.

properties.name: force_update
properties.description: (Optional, int) A counter that triggers an update even if no relevant parameters have been changed. See Docker Spec.

properties.name: runtime
properties.description: (Optional, string) Runtime is the type of runtime specified for the task executor. See Docker Runtime.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) Ids of the networks in which the container will be put in.

properties.name: log_driver
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Log Driver below for details.

properties.name: containerspec
properties.description: » ContainerSpec

container_spec is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The container_spec block is the spec for each container and supports the following:

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Required, string) The image used to create the Docker service.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of string/string key/value pairs) User-defined key/value metadata.

properties.name: command
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings) The command to be run in the image.

properties.name: args
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings) Arguments to the command.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Optional, string) The hostname to use for the container, as a valid RFC 1123 hostname.

properties.name: env
properties.description: (Optional, map of string/string) A list of environment variables in the form VAR=value.

properties.name: dir
properties.description: (Optional, string) The working directory for commands to run in.

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Optional, string) The user inside the container.

properties.name: groups
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings) A list of additional groups that the container process will run as.

properties.name: privileges
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Privileges below for details.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description: (Optional, bool) Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.

properties.name: mounts
properties.description: (Optional, set of blocks) See Mounts below for details.

properties.name: stop_signal
properties.description: (Optional, string) Signal to stop the container.

properties.name: stop_grace_period
properties.description: (Optional, string) Amount of time to wait for the container to terminate before forcefully removing it (ms|s|m|h).

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Healthcheck below for details.

properties.name: list description
ip
properties.description: (Required string) The ip

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Required string) The hostname

properties.name: dns_config
properties.description: (Optional, block) See DNS Config below for details.

properties.name: secrets
properties.description: (Optional, set of blocks) See Secrets below for details.

properties.name: configs
properties.description: (Optional, set of blocks) See Configs below for details.

properties.name: isolation
properties.description: (Optional, string) Isolation technology of the containers running the service. (Windows only). Valid values are: default|process|hyperv

properties.name: privileges-1
properties.description: » Privileges

privileges is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The privileges block holds the security options for the container and supports the following:

properties.name: list description
file
properties.description: (Optional, string) Load credential spec from this file.

properties.name: registry
properties.description: (Optional, string) Load credential spec from this value in the Windows registry.

properties.name: list description
disable
properties.description: (Optional, bool) Disable SELinux

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Optional, string) SELinux user label

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Optional, string) SELinux role label

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional, string) SELinux type label

properties.name: level
properties.description: (Optional, string) SELinux level label

properties.name: mounts-1
properties.description: » Mounts

mount is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra mount mappings for the container. Each mount block is the Specification for mounts to be added to containers created as part of the service and supports the following:

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required, string) The container path.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional, string) The mount source (e.g., a volume name, a host path)

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required, string) The mount type: valid values are bind|volume|tmpfs.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description: (Optional, string) Whether the mount should be read-only

properties.name: list description
propagation
properties.description: (Optional, string) A propagation mode with the value.

properties.name: list description
no_copy
properties.description: (Optional, string) Whether to populate volume with data from the target.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: (Optional, map of key/value pairs) Adding labels.

properties.name: driver_config
properties.description: (Optional, map) The name of the driver to create the volume.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional, string) The name of the driver to create the volume.

properties.name: options
properties.description: (Optional, map of key/value pairs) Options for the driver.

properties.name: list description
size_bytes
properties.description: (Optional, int) The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional, int) The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer.

properties.name: healthcheck-1
properties.description: » Healthcheck

healthcheck is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra healthcheck configuration for the containers of the service. The healthcheck block is a test to perform to check that the container is healthy and supports the following:

properties.name: test
properties.description: (Required, list of strings) Command to run to check health. For example, to run curl -f http://localhost/health set the command to be ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost/health"].

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional, string) Time between running the check (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional, string) Maximum time to allow one check to run (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: start_period
properties.description: (Optional, string) Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable (ms|s|m|h). Default: 0s.

properties.name: retries
properties.description: (Optional, int) Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Default: 0.

properties.name: dns-config
properties.description: » DNS Config
dns_config is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra DNS configuration for the containers of the service. The dns_config block supports the following:

properties.name: nameservers
properties.description: (Required, list of strings) The IP addresses of the name servers, for example, 8.8.8.8

properties.name: search
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings)A search list for host-name lookup.

properties.name: options
properties.description: (Optional, list of strings) A list of internal resolver variables to be modified, for example, debug, ndots:3

properties.name: secrets-1
properties.description: » Secrets

secrets is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra mount mappings for the container. Each secrets block is a reference to a secret that will be exposed to the service and supports the following:

properties.name: secret_id
properties.description: (Required, string) ConfigID represents the ID of the specific secret.

properties.name: secret_name
properties.description: (Optional, string) The name of the secret that this references, but internally it is just provided for lookup/display purposes

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: (Required, string) Represents the final filename in the filesystem. The specific target file that the secret data is written within the docker container, e.g. /root/secret/secret.json

properties.name: configs-1
properties.description: » Configs

configs is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the extra mount mappings for the container. Each configs is a reference to a secret that is exposed to the service and supports the following:

properties.name: config_id
properties.description: (Required, string) ConfigID represents the ID of the specific config.

properties.name: config_name
properties.description: (Optional, string) The name of the config that this references, but internally it is just provided for lookup/display purposes

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: (Required, string) Represents the final filename in the filesystem. The specific target file that the config data is written within the docker container, e.g. /root/config/config.json

properties.name: resources-1
properties.description: » Resources

resources is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The resources block represents the requirements which apply to each container created as part of the service and supports the following:

properties.name: list description
nano_cpus
properties.description: (Optional, int) CPU shares in units of 1/1e9 (or 10<sup>-9)</sup> of the CPU. Should be at least 1000000

properties.name: memory_bytes
properties.description: (Optional, int) The amount of memory in bytes the container allocates

properties.name: generic_resources
properties.description: (Optional, map) User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, SSD=3) or String resources (e.g, GPU=UUID1)

properties.name: named_resources_spec
properties.description: (Optional, set of string) The String resources, delimited by =

properties.name: discrete_resources_spec
properties.description: (Optional, set of string) The Integer resources, delimited by =

properties.name: list description
nano_cpus
properties.description: (Optional, int) CPU shares in units of 1/1e9 (or 10<sup>-9)</sup> of the CPU. Should be at least 1000000

properties.name: memory_bytes
properties.description: (Optional, int) The amount of memory in bytes the container allocates

properties.name: generic_resources
properties.description: (Optional, map) User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, SSD=3) or String resources (e.g, GPU=UUID1)

properties.name: named_resources_spec
properties.description: (Optional, set of string) The String resources

properties.name: discrete_resources_spec
properties.description: (Optional, set of string) The Integer resources

properties.name: restart-policy
properties.description: » Restart Policy

restart_policy is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The restart_policy block specifies the restart policy which applies to containers created as part of this service and supports the following:

properties.name: condition
properties.description: (Optional, string) Condition for restart: (none|on-failure|any)

properties.name: delay
properties.description: (Optional, string) Delay between restart attempts (ms|s|m|h)

properties.name: max_attempts
properties.description: (Optional, string) Maximum attempts to restart a given container before giving up (default value is 0, which is ignored)

properties.name: window
properties.description: (Optional, string) The time window used to evaluate the restart policy (default value is 0, which is unbounded) (ms|s|m|h)

properties.name: placement-1
properties.description: » Placement

placement is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The placement block specifies the placement preferences and supports the following:

properties.name: constraints
properties.description: (Optional, set of strings) An array of constraints. e.g.: node.role==manager

properties.name: prefs
properties.description: (Optional, set of string) Preferences provide a way to make the scheduler aware of factors such as topology. They are provided in order from highest to lowest precedence, e.g.: spread=node.role.manager

properties.name: list description
architecture
properties.description: (Required, string) The architecture, e.g., amd64

properties.name: os
properties.description: (Required, string) The operation system, e.g., linux

properties.name: log-driver
properties.description: » Log Driver

log_driver is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra log_driver configuration for the containers of the service. The log_driver specifies the log driver to use for tasks created from this spec. If not present, the default one for the swarm will be used, finally falling back to the engine default if not specified. The block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The logging driver to use. Either (none|json-file|syslog|journald|gelf|fluentd|awslogs|splunk|etwlogs|gcplogs).

properties.name: options
properties.description: (Optional, a map of strings and strings) The options for the logging driver, e.g.

options {
  awslogs-region = "us-west-2"
  awslogs-group  = "dev/foo-service"
}

properties.name: mode-2
properties.description: » Mode
mode is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the mode configuration for the service. The mode block supports the following:

properties.name: global
properties.description: (Optional, bool) set it to true to run the service in the global mode

resource "docker_service" "foo" {
  ...
  mode {
    global = true
  }
  ...
}

properties.name: replicated
properties.description: (Optional, map), which contains atm only the amount of replicas

resource "docker_service" "foo" {
  ...
  mode {
    replicated {
      replicas = 2
    }
  }
  ...
}

NOTE on mode: if neither global nor replicated is specified, the service is started in replicated mode with 1 replica. A change of service mode is not possible. The service has to be destroyed an recreated in the new mode.

properties.name: updateconfig-and-rollbackconfig
properties.description: » UpdateConfig and RollbackConfig

update_config or rollback_config is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra update configuration for the containers of the service. The update_config rollback_config block supports the following:

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: (Optional, int) The maximum number of tasks to be updated in one iteration simultaneously (0 to update all at once).

properties.name: delay
properties.description: (Optional, int) Delay between updates (ns|us|ms|s|m|h), e.g. 5s.

properties.name: failure_action
properties.description: (Optional, int) Action on update failure: pause|continue|rollback.

properties.name: monitor
properties.description: (Optional, int) Duration after each task update to monitor for failure (ns|us|ms|s|m|h)

properties.name: max_failure_ratio
properties.description: (Optional, string) The failure rate to tolerate during an update as float. Important: the floatneed to be wrapped in a string to avoid internal casting and precision errors.

properties.name: order
properties.description: (Optional, int) Update order either 'stop-first' or 'start-first'.

properties.name: endpointspec
properties.description: » EndpointSpec
endpoint_spec is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify properties that can be configured to access and load balance a service. The block supports the following:

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) The mode of resolution to use for internal load balancing between tasks. (vip|dnsrr). Default: vip.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: (Optional, block) See Ports below for details.

properties.name: ports-1
properties.description: » Ports
ports is a block within the configuration that can be repeated to specify the port mappings of the container. Each ports block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional, string) A random name for the port.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional, string) Protocol that can be used over this port: tcp|udp|sctp. Default: tcp.

properties.name: target_port
properties.description: (Required, int) Port inside the container.

properties.name: published_port
properties.description: (Required, int) The port on the swarm hosts. If not set the value of target_port will be used.

properties.name: publish_mode
properties.description: (Optional, string) Represents the mode in which the port is to be published: ingress|host

properties.name: converge-config
properties.description: » Converge Config

converge_config is a block within the configuration that can be repeated only once to specify the extra Converging configuration for the containers of the service. This is the same behavior as the docker cli. By adding this configuration, it is monitored with the given interval that, e.g., all tasks/replicas of a service are up and healthy
The converge_config block supports the following:

properties.name: delay
properties.description: (Optional, string) Time between each the check to check docker endpoint (ms|s|m|h). For example, to check if all tasks are up when a service is created, or to check if all tasks are successfully updated on an update. Default: 7s.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional, string) The timeout of the service to reach the desired state (s|m). Default: 3m.
